articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Desperate search for cruise passengers after American tests positive for coronavirus
articles.description: Officials in Cambodia are scrambling to track down hundreds of Americans who may have been exposed to the virus after a passenger on a cruise ship that docked there tested positive.

articles.author: Julian Shen-Berro
articles.title: Students say colleges need to combat virus-fueled racism
articles.description: As fears over the coronavirus reach college campuses, students worry that their universities are not doing enough to address discrimination and xenophobia.
articles.content:
A social media post spread through the Barnard College and Columbia University campuses on Manhattan's Upper West Side, quickly garnering hundreds of comments and shares earlier this month.
In it, a Chinese student at Barnard who had self-quarantined herself… [+5956 chars]

articles.author: Herb Weisbaum
articles.title: How to avoid falling victim to a coronavirus email scam
articles.description: Cybercriminals are exploiting coronavirus fears by stealing money and infecting computers with scam emails that mimic the CDC and the World Health Organization.
articles.content:
If you got an email from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention or the World Health Organization about the coronavirus outbreak, would you read it? Maybe click on a link? Cybercriminals are counting on it.
The outbreak is a dream come true for crimin… [+6133 chars]

articles.description: First Read is your briefing from "Meet the Press" and the NBC Political Unit on the day's most important political stories and why they matter.
articles.content:
LAS VEGAS — Tomorrow night here will be the ninth presidential debate for five of the Democratic candidates — Bernie Sanders, Joe Biden, Pete Buttigieg, Elizabeth Warren and Amy Klobuchar.

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: HSBC cuts headcount by 35,000 in deep overhaul
articles.description: HSBC will shed some 35,000 jobs as part of a deep overhaul to focus on faster-growing markets in Asia.
articles.content:
LONDON HSBC will shed some 35,000 jobs as part of a deep overhaul to focus on faster-growing markets in Asia and as it tries to cope with a slew of global uncertainties, from Brexit to the trade wars to the new coronavirus.
